intro: Tetraphylax quadrilocularis, commonly known as the four-chambered liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct leaf-like structure called a thallus, which is divided into four chambers, giving it its scientific name. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporocarps. Tetraphylax quadrilocularis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
